title: What singer or group would you absolutely love to see in a concert, but know you (probably) never will? - Quora

response.answer_text: These are some of the singers or bands, whom I wish to see live-in-concert but I know I'll never see them.  Swedish House Mafia.There will be always a missing space in my life, where I will tell myself. I never attended SHM gig!I was not there when Axwell, Steve Angello and Sebastian Ingrosso, altogether dropped beats while I could be singing 'Don't worry child... See Heaven's got plans for you'My favorite DJ group split up on 2012. Though, they just removed Steve Angello and abolished the name. While other two swedish DJs continued working together under the name Axwell /\ Ingrosso and I really like their new releases but still it doesn't have that charm like Swedish House Mafia had.   " They Came, They Raved, We Loved "Westlife.One of my favorite Pop music band. I was taken away by their album Coast to Coast in 2010, but soon they announced their splitting in 2011.I will always miss them!

Pretty much any band I like, but which also has the bad fortune (from my perspective) of being hugely popular. Thing is, I love concerts, but they have to be small to medium sized; there's no band on the planet worth going to a stadium-type concert where you're so far from the stage that they need to put up huge screens so that you'll see what's going on at all for. If I want to watch a band on a screen, I can do that without leaving my living-room thankyouverymuch. Also, bands and artists who are retired, or nearly so; technically you might still be able to go to a Rolling Stones concert (assuming you're fine with it being huge), but practically speaking, you're decades too late for that; and I personally won't bother, not even in the extremely unlikely event that they'd hold a small concert somewhere in my viscinity.

You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'd have loved to see Beatles perform live. Because they knew how to take a sad song and make it better. And they taught me that all I need is love. It would have been interesting to see a day in their life. I would be twisting and shouting at their songs. But it's all in yesterday now. Way across the universe it is. So, now I have let it be.But when I'm sixty-four And sitting in my strawberry fields,I'd still be singing their songs eight days a weekBecause In my life, I've loved them all.

Clann Zú, a mesmerizing Australian-Irish band, that unfortunately disbanded in 2005, just when I was only a few months into discovering them.      Queen, and I don't need to list any reason, but I will still add here a song we all know.    Other bands/singers that I might not get to see, but who knows: PusciferTarkanRiverside - I managed to miss seeing them twice! :(RishlooDisturbed - probably the one I'll most likely get to seeThe Decemberists

Undoubtedly The man who himself was a Ghazal.  ​I was promised by my husband (back when he was my bf in a long distance relationship) that he would definitely take me to one of his shows. But by the time we got married, Jagjit Singh left for his heavenly abode.Till this day we really regret not being able to attend the Master's  live concert.
My lifetime concert “bucket list" is … Zeppelin Floyd The Who Two are no gos and I certainly couldn't afford the ticket price for The Who. So…..
